title: Radx data hub study metadata template for evaluation template schema
description: Radx data hub study metadata template for evaluation template schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.7.1

propertyDescriptions.studyProgram: An organization or entity responsible for study data management, monitoring, and analyses during clinical studies. The four RADx (C)DCCs include RADx-rad, RADx Tech, RADx-UP, and RADx DHT.
propertyDescriptions.studyPhs: This field represents the unique identifier for a study, always starting with the prefix "phs" followed by six digits. The "phs" prefix signifies that the study pertains to phenotype data, and the subsequent six digits serve as the specific identifier for the study. This standardized format ensures consistent referencing and easy identification of phenotype studies across datasets and repositories.
propertyDescriptions.studyTitle: The official name or title of the study, used to clearly identify the research project.
propertyDescriptions.description: A brief but detailed original summary of the design and aims, population information, molecular technologies employed, principal findings of the study, and data that will be available through dbGaP.
propertyDescriptions.radxAcknowledgements: This field captures the specific language used to acknowledge RADx funding and support in the study. It typically includes the funding source, program name (e.g., RADx-UP, RADx-rad, RADx DHT, RADx Tech), and any additional data access acknowledgments for resources like dbGaP or the NIH RADx Data Hub.
propertyDescriptions.nihGrantNumbers: The specific grant number assigned by the National Institutes of Health (NIH) that funded the study. It is used to track and reference the financial support provided by NIH for the research project.
propertyDescriptions.studyStartDate: The date when the study officially begins, marking the start of data collection or research activities.
propertyDescriptions.studyEndDate: The date when the study officially concludes, marking the end of data collection or research activities.
propertyDescriptions.studyReleaseDate: The date when the study data or findings are officially made available to the public or specified audience.
propertyDescriptions.updatedDate: The date when the study data or metadata was last modified or updated.
propertyDescriptions.foaNumbers: A unique identifier for a Funding Opportunity Announcement (FOA), used to reference specific grant or funding opportunities.
propertyDescriptions.foaUrls: The web link that directs to the official webpage of the Funding Opportunity Announcement (FOA), providing detailed information about the funding opportunity.
propertyDescriptions.principalInvestigator: The primary investigator or project leader responsible for the study, serving as the main point of contact for inquiries related to the research.
propertyDescriptions.studyDoi: This field contains the unique identifier for the study in the format "10.xxxx/xxxxx", where "10.xxxx" is the prefix assigned to the publisher, and "xxxxx" is the suffix uniquely identifying the study. It is assigned to studies to increase findability, accessibility, and reusability. When citing RADx resource use in publications and other outputs, users should include the resources' DOI.
propertyDescriptions.clinicaltrialsUrl: ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier for this study if applicable. For example, NCT01274598. The final link that will be on the public page will be https://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT01274598.
propertyDescriptions.studyDesign: The methodological approach or framework used in the study to collect and analyze data. The design provides a structure for the study, guiding how the research is conducted and data is interpreted.
propertyDescriptions.dataTypes: The categories or disciplines under which the study is conducted. One or more study types. For example: Behavioral, Clinical, Questionnaires/Surveys, etc.
propertyDescriptions.studyDomains: The primary areas or topics of focus within the study. One or more study domains. For example, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, Wastewater Surveillance, COVID Hotspots, etc.
propertyDescriptions.nihInstitutesOrCenters: This field lists one or more NIH Institutes and Centers associated with the study.
propertyDescriptions.studyPopulationFocus: One or more population groups that are the focus of the study.
propertyDescriptions.species: Type of data involved in the study. The value can be Human Data or Non-Human data.
propertyDescriptions.consentOrDataUseLimitations: The restrictions or limitations on how the study data can be used
propertyDescriptions.hasDataFiles: This boolean field indicates whether the study includes associated data files. The value can be "Yes" if data files are present or "No" if they are not.
propertyDescriptions.studySize: Size of the study (all data files) submitted to RADx Data Hub in MB.
propertyDescriptions.creationDate: Date when the study was first initiated/created in the RADx Hub Online Submission
propertyDescriptions.diseaseSpecificGroup: Data use limitations for the Disease-Specific consent group
propertyDescriptions.studyStatus: The current approval status of the study. It can either be "Approved," meaning the study has received all necessary approvals to proceed, or "In Review," indicating that the study is still undergoing the review process and has not yet been approved.
propertyDescriptions.rapidsLink: URL to the Rapid AI Platform for Innovating Data Science (RAPIDS) platform
